Package com.shouldis.bitset.parallel

Class DeadBiterator

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.parallel.Biterator
com.shouldis.bitset.parallel.DeadBiterator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Spliterator<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.Spliterator.OfInt, java.util.Spliterator.OfPrimitive<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.function.IntConsumer,​java.util.Spliterator.OfInt>
public final class DeadBiterator
extends Biterator
Implementation of Biterator used to stream the indices of dead bits within a BitSet, splitting at appropriate indices to manipulate a BitSet in parallel. Words are cached as they are encountered, so any modifications after iteration begins may not be included.
Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
Biterator

  • Field Details

    • set

      private final BitSet set
      The BitSet that the dead bit indices will be calculated from.

  • Constructor Details

    • DeadBiterator

      public DeadBiterator​(BitSet set, int position, int end)
      Creates a DeadBiterator that will cover all dead bits within the specified range [position, end).
      Parameters:
      set - The BitSet that the dead bit indices will be calculated from.
      position - (inclusive) the first index to include.
      end - (exclusive) the index after the last index to include.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if position is greater than or equal to end, or less than 0.
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if end is greater than set.size.

    • DeadBiterator

      public DeadBiterator​(BitSet set)
      Creates a DeadBiterator that will cover all dead bits within the specified BitSet set.
      Parameters:
      set - The BitSet that the dead bit indices will be calculated from.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.

  • Method Details

    • next

      private int next​(int index)
      Calculates the index of the next dead bit after the specified index, including that index. All bits indices until Biterator.end will be checked. If no live bits are found, Biterator.end is returned.
      Parameters:
      index - (inclusive) the first index to check.
      Returns:
      the index of the next dead bit, or Biterator.end if none were found.

    • tryAdvance

      public boolean tryAdvance​(java.util.function.IntConsumer action)
